content.location: Upper Ledge at Arms Deal, Teton Canyon, Wyoming

content.description: Burly and very steep varied jam crack. Tape may be a good idea for this one.
content.protection: Assorted cams from fingers up to fists. One bolt is on the left at the lip of the overhang to keep the rope from sucking gear into the crack. Gear anchor, walk off climber's left.
content.location: The large, obvious crack just off right center of the 45 degree overhang. Immediately to the right of Arms Deal.

content.description: Phenomenal route with super classic moves. Takes equal parts technique and brawn. The first three bolts are fun and juggy moving you into an okay shake out stance. Then it's on with less than ideal holds, small feet, funky moves (I won't give any key beta away!) and lots of core tension up until the 6th bolt.
content.protection: 6 bolts. 2 bolt chain anchor. Stick clipping the first bolt is smart.
content.location: Find the bolted dihedral in the center of the 45 degree overhang. Just left of a vertical crack splitting the overhang known as the Munger Crack.
